1.content:
This is it, you are finally on your way to Arcane Academy and you could't be any happier. You were always a sort of loner in high-school, sure you had a couple of friends for a while but they either moved away or fell in with the wrong crowd just to be socially accepted more. You weren't like that, you didn't care if you fitted in with everyone else, you cared about being you and if they didn't like it then it was their problem.
So you always used your spare time to study your favorite thing in the world, Magic.

Your grades in other subjects were fine, except for math (you had some trouble in the past trying to understand it), but you always excelled in magic. But you never thought that you would actually be accepted to a school like this, it was a dream come true!

You were on the bus on the way to the Academy.

"Hey" you hear a voice from the seat behind you.

"Are you new here too?" she asks

"Yeah" you respond "First year, I'm pretty excited"

"Me too. My name is Terra. It's nice to meet you" she says

Terra had long light-brown hair and blue eyes. She looks to be about 17-18 years old.

"Nice to meet you too, my name is (*Name*)" you respond

"She seems pretty nice" you think to yourself

You hear people talking in awe and excitement, you turn to see the you were now pulling up to Arcane Academy.

"Here we are!" says Terra

"It's amazing!" you say

And it was, you couldn't wait to actually see the inside, rumor has it the there is an enchantment on the whole building that actually makes it bigger on the inside as well as a protective barrier.

You and Terra get off of the bus together since you were sitting next to eachother and head inside. The inside looked even more spectacular and it does look far larger on the inside.

"Hello students!" says an older voice

"My name is Corvenus, I am the Archmage here at the Academy"

Corvenus was an older gentleman, probably in his 50's or early 60's.
He had a short trimmed grey beard and grey hair, he wore a black suit and was wearing a green scarf... not sure why.

"Welcome to my school. You are all here because of your passion for the arcane arts. Let me tell you that there is no cause more noble than to understand and use magic for the betterment of the world. If you take your studies and tasks seriously, you will find power. Use this great power in vain however, and you will bring nothing but suffering and regret. Please heed these words carefully for they are the same words that my Archmage taught me when I myself had enrolled."

The tone of excitement and awe suddenly had turned to that of seriousness and some were even intimidated by how Archmage Corvenus had spoken.

Suddenly a smile appeared on his face.

"And now, without further ado, I leave you to your Keepers."

Keepers were the mages responsible for keeping order in the school, if anything were to go wrong they were responsible for resolving the problem. They are also the official referees for things such as combative magic duels.

As Corvenus walked away, presumably to his office, you see a pair of Keepers walk up to the crowd of new students. One of them begins to speak.

"Would all new students please seperate into two groups! One side Male, the other Female. After which we will lead you to your respective dormatories."

Which group are you in?
1.title: The ride there.

choices: Key #568... wait, how many rooms are there?
11.content:
"I guess I'll see you later, (*Name*)" says Terra with a wave

"Yeah. See you later." you say as you go to the boy's side.

After everybody had been seperated, your group's Keeper starts leading to your dorms.

"Remember, students. Your dorms are on the east wing of the academy. Do not disturb the girl's dorms on the west side of the academy or you will face punishment." says the Keeper.

"That's harsh, man." says one of the students

"Those are the rules." replies the Keeper

After about 10 minutes of walking, you finally reach your dorms.

"Everybody, please line up for selection!" you hear an older Keeper call out.
"Time to find out who your roommate is!"

This keeper looked different from the others. So far, the only ones that you have seen looked very serious, this guy appeared to be smiling and excited to see the new students.

In a few moments, all of the male students had lined up in front of the older Keeper.
He then started to pull keys with numbers, almost at random, out of his pocket.

"Take a key, the number on the key designates which room is yours!"

One at a time, students were given a key to the dorm rooms.

Which key did you get?
11.title: The boy's group

112.content:
As soon as you are given your key, you're surprised to see the number. Not thinking that it'll be that bad, you were mistaken as soon as you see the long hallway. Yes, there are multiple floors, but 62 is a ways down. Might as well start walking.

         Grabbing your stuff, you start walking down the hallway and are impressed by the architecture of the building. There were also many sculptures of many creatures, too, like dragons, griffins, krakens, etc.

         Soon after a surprisingly not tiring walk, you enter your room. It wasn't much different than what you would see in an average dorm, two or three beds, a few dressers with lamps and some desks, and a bathroom... which hopefully won't be a problem. Taking a bed near the window, you set you things here and there, making it as comfortable as you can for yourself.

         As soon as you reach into your bag for a few frames you took, you see that it was a family portrait, of a time when you all went out together one last time before moving to the Academy. Smiling, you set it down on your dresser. Suddenly, you hear a knock. Must be your roommate[s].

         As soon as you open the door, you happen to see that it is...
112.title: Better wake up early!

choices: looks, or as a spare bed.
The room's familiar. It'll act as caretaker.
1121.content:
You look over and see another student walk in. Most likely your room-mate considering the large amount of boxes he was carrying.

"Hey, you must be- Whoa!" you hear from him right as he drops his boxes all over himself.

You chuckle a bit at the scene since it looks like something right out of a sitcom when it happens.

"Yeah yeah, real funny. Would you mind giving me a hand though?" He asks, unable to move from the immense weight of school supplies and belongings that he brought with him.

"Oh, yeah. Sorry." you say as you move to assist your new room-mate.

"Holy crap! What's in these things? Bricks?" you ask as you lift the apparent box-O-rocks off of him.

"Nah, it's just books and spell components." He replies now sitting up, revealing mid-length black hair, brown eyes, and pale skin
"My name's Eric. And it looks like I'm your new room-mate."

You help him to his feet as he stretches his arms and back from carrying the large amount of cardboard boulders

"Good to meet you. My name's *Name*" you say, shaking his hand.

"So this is where we'll be staying, huh?" he asks "Honestly, I expected it to be a bit fancier looking considering how this is like the top school in magic. But it's not bad."
He continues to scan the room a bit more.
"Yeah, definitely better than New York" he concludes.

"So you're from New York then?" you ask, hoping to strike a conversation and get to know him a bit better.

"Actually, I'm from Quebec, in Canada. But my parents insisted on moving to New York for work purposes. Let me tell 'ya, it was not fun."

"I've been to New York once, it didn't look too bad." you reply, thinking back to that one trip you and your family took a couple years back.

"Yeah, you were probably in the nice part of town." he retorts "We had a little place in the slums for a while, and when I say little, I mean little. A taxi probably could have provided more space. And don't get me started on the crime rate."

Sounds like this guy's been through a lot...

"I'm just happy to be here, ya'know?" he asked looking at you with a smile

"Yeah, I'm actually really excited."

"Cool. But just so things are clear, I don't swing with guys."

Whoa! where'd that come from?!

"That was random..." you say, kindof dumbfounded by his sudden statement.

"I know, but I've already been hit-on by dudes in the past and I didn't want anything happening. Why do people keep thinking that I'm gay?!?"

You ponder it for a second...

"Maybe it's the hair?" you say

"Holy shit, are you serious?!?" He says while looking in a mirror. It was true, it looks like he treats his hair far more than that of the average guy. You also notice the 12 different hair products sitting in one of the boxes.

"There's nothing wrong with taking care of your hair!" he says swiping some strands to the side.

"Yeah, but... maybe you're taking it a bit far?"

"I couldn't disagree more, *Name*" he says, brushing his hair while sitting down on his claimed bed.

"Whatever, anyway is there supposed to be someone else showing up? I saw another bed."

"Oh, that's just for..."
1121.title: Behind door number one...

choices: "let's finish setting up our stuff and we'll go."
"one of us go and and find then, just to be sure."
11211.content:
"Everyone gets at least 3 roommates, four, if they're lucky," Eric says. Speaking of which, you hear a knock. Must be him.

         "I'll get it," you say. After opening the door, you see another guy, winded, looks more frail, but on account of his glasses, probably smarter than you two already here.

         "Um, is this #62?" he asks.

         "Is that a rhetorical question?" you jokingly ask. He just smiles and rolls his eyes.

         "Oh, haha, guy. Help me out here?"

         "Yeah, sure." It was just a box anyway... heavy as hell!

         "Dude--"

         "It's Samuel, but yes?" You held back a laugh.

         "What's in here?"

         "Just the basics. I hear things will get better throughout." Basics? You don't want to know what advanced is then.

         After that workout, you dust yourself off. "Well then, I'm [your name], and this is Eric."

          He takes a look at him and asks, "How well do you take care of your hair?"

         "This box here contains all my hair care," Eric replies. "If you want to, help yourselves out."

         "Meh, I'll think about it. So, what's next?"

         "I think we're supposed to meet up in the mess hall," you answer. "They're gonna give an intro to teachers and such. I couldn't hear when exactly, though."

         "Well, that's promising," Eric muses. "Then..."
11211.title: Door #2

choices: Talk a walk around the school. I've got time.
Finish unpacking and just relax a bit before the speech.
112111.content:
You head over to your bed and open one of the boxes you set down at the end.

"Well, might as well set up shop." you say, pulling out some neatly... well, semi-folded clothes as your new room-mates do much of the same.

"So, anyone see any of the girls here? They're pretty cute." says Eric, hoping to start up a manly conversation.

"Really? That's what you're focused on?" asks Samuel. "I thought that by coming to Arcane Academy that you'd be a bit more interested in learning, oh I dunno, magic?"

"Of course! But that doesn't mean that we have to do nothing else but schoolwork" he responds with gusto. "[Name] can agree with me here. I already saw him talking to a cute girl on the ride here"

"You were watching us?" you ask him

"Nope. I was watching HER." Eric puts you into a headlock and continues "So what's her name, huh? Did she give you her number already?"

"Her name is Terra." you gasp as you try to release yourself from Eric's hold "And it's none of your business."

"I'll take that as a yes." he says with a triumphent smile, albeit without good reason.

"Let go of me!"

"Fine. But you're gonna introduce me to her."

"Not on your life."

You struggle for another moment before you get a hold of Eric's hair. You didn't pull it or anything, but just scratching your fingers through it to mess it up was enough to change his focus to something other than bugging you.

"Woah! Not cool." he says as he looks for a hairbrush.

"He did say to let go." says Samuel, who is now just reading a book on his bed. It also appears that he has already finished unpacking.

"Anyway, the speech isn't for another two hours or so." he continues "Since you didn't hear."

What to do now...

Eric's too focused with his ravaged lockes to do much of anything, and Samuel seems content with just reading.
112111.title: Home sweet home

choices: Actually, I have something I need to do before the speech...
1121111.content:
"A couple hours huh?" you ask as you look outside.

It was beautiful outside, not too bright or too hot out. A perfect day for a walk.
You look back at your pile of things in your spot. Your clothes and essentials were already unpacked, so the other things could wait. A relaxing walk would be nice after that long bus ride anyway.

"I think I'm gonna head out for a bit" you say

"Where to?" asked a curious Samuel.

"Nowhere in particular, I guess." you respond "Just gonna stretch my legs."

"It does look like a nice day for it." says Samuel "I may join you later."

"Sounds good. I'll see you guys later" you say as you open the door back into the hallway. Not hearing a response from either. Probably too busy to notice.

--------------------------------------

You get up from the bench you chose to take a quick rest at.
This place is huge! You've already been walking for an hour and you haven't managed to see all of the campus.

This place is just a marvel of architecture. The buildings have amazing carvings on them reprisenting different creatures and mages, the towers overlooking the school look like they're chisled from polished marbel! The whole thing has even been preserved from the 1800s...

"Hey!" you hear a familiar voice from nearby.

You look up to see who...

"Hey, Terra. How's it going?" you ask

"It's going well, actually." she says as she walks up to you. "Isn't this place amazing?"

"Yeah it is." you say back "It's a bit bigger than I expected."

"It's just like I thought it would be, minus the room-mate thing." she says, with an almost angry expression.

"You're having issues with your room-mate?"

"You don't know the half of it"

You try to think of a way to change the subject to soemthing a bit more pleasant.

"Hey, I saw what looked like a garden nearby when I was passing through. Wanna check it out?" You ask, hoping to also to get to know her a bit better.

"Well..."
1121111.title: A Morning Walk...

choices: Samuel. Looks like he keeps his promises.
Her roommates. What was the problem again?
11211111.content:
"Sure, why not?" Terra says, "we have about an hour. Might as well use the time for something nice."

You inwardly smile and see that despite Eric's jokes this was going better than expected. You were actually thinking that it can actually become something else. She was definitely pretty, as well as nice. And after talking to her a bit, she's also pretty smart.

"Well then, let's use the most of it." you say. She nods and follows you. The sheer size of the place was forcing you to take a while, so you decided to chat with Terra.

"So, Terra--"

"Please, call me Tariah," she stopped. "Terra is just a nickname, really."

Well that's interesting. "How'd you get it then?"

"It's just coincidence, actually. I liked going places, like to the woods and such. Heck, I even raised my own garden. It's just something about nature that I really like. Eventually, as a joke, Terra replaced my name, but I got used to it, believe it or not."

"That makes sense," you reply. "It suits you."

You weren't sure, but it looked like she was trying to hide a blush. "Thanks, [your name]."

Eventually, you reached your destination. Terra goes into awe as she saw the beautifully laid garden.

"Wow, the flowers here are beautiful!" she says, leaning down to better see and smell the flowers.

"Maybe your nickname should've been Flora instead," you joke, earning you a slight shove.

"Most people don't know that story, [your name]," she relies. "Either you got lucky or it was..."

after a paused moment you ask "Was what?"

"Oh, nothing" she says

For a moment, there was silence. The smell of flowers in the air and a quick breeze made the moment almost into something from a storybook. Terra only smiled as she strolled around the garden with you. You soon decide to break the silence...

"So Tariah, uh--"

"There you are!" you heard, interrupting your sentence. Who was it?
11211111.title: Strolling about the greenery

choices: "It's about time for the speech. Let's go"
112111111.content:
"Oh, hey, Samuel." you say, not really expecting him here. "What are you doing here?"

"I did say that I may join you earlier" he says back, now looking at Terra with curiousity.

"Wow, Eric was right. You do work quickly." He continues, earning questioning looks from Terra at both you and Samuel. "Is she the same girl from the bus?"

"Hi. My name is Terra." she says.

"Ah, so it is the cute girl from the bus then."

"Cute, huh?" she asks with a sly smile.

"I never said that she was cute" you stammer, nervously

"Oh, so you don't think I'm cute then?" she says with false sadness

"I never said that either!" you retort

"He's right. Eric was the one that said you were cute. After watching you on the bus." Samuel responds, blatently.

"So your friend was watching us?" she asks

"I didn't know until after." You say, defensively. Hoping to god that this embarrasment would end, that everything would go back to that nice moment in the garden.

"It's fine." she says, almost shrugging it off, thankfully. "What I want to know is..." oh no

"Do you think I'm cute, [Your Name]?" she asks with puppy dog eyes.

At this point, it was obvious on how she was going to tease you. She probably thought that this was fun, seeing you stammer, waiting for you to say something just to turn it into another insult.

"Well..."

"You really shouldn't keep a lady waiting, [Your Name]." Samuel says, joining in on her game

You glare at him, as he just holds a faint smile and cold eyes behind his glasses.

"And what did he mean by 'You work fast'?" she adds to the fray "Are you courting other girls here too?" She said that a bit liuder than before, attracting a few glances and glares from nearby students also walking the grounds.

"Who said I was courting anyone!?" you say

"Oh, so you were just teasing me?"

This was torture. You would do anything to get out of this. You were seriouly considering faking a stomach bug and escaping to the infirmary.

Suddenly, Terra bursts out into laughter...

"You should see your face, [Your Name]" says Terra with a big smile.

"I'm seriously regretting this walk." you say under your breath

"Don't say that, [Your Name]" says Eric, who walks up to the three of you. "She's having a grand time of just teasing you."

"Seems the two of you have something in common" you retort, face no longer red of embarrasement.

"That's cold, [Your Name]" he says before directing his attention to Terra "By the way, my name's Eric. And you must be the lovely Terra." he says with a bow.

"Ah, so you were the one that was staring at me on the bus." she replies.

Eric immediately stands ups straight, mouth agape at you.

"You told her!?!"

"Nope. it was Samuel." you say back.

Eric then puts Samuel into a very familiar looking headlock at incredible speed.
You just watch for a moment as they go at it, Eric trying to hold Sam down.

"So these are your room-mates then?" Terra asks

"For better or worse." you say with a sigh

A few minutes pass as they continue. Apparently the keepers nearby didn't think of it as too much of an issue, which was fine since it wasn't what anyone could really call a fight. Eventually, Samuel seems to get a hold of Eric's lordly hair enough to mess it up, at which point Eric immediately retreats. It's not a surprise that he can just reach into his pocket and find a comb to deal with this situation.

Samuel get's off the ground, dusting off his clothes.

"Nice moves" you say

"I learned from the best" he says, watching Eric desperately try to fix his hair.

"Well, guys..." says Terra
112111111.title: Bad timing...

1121111112.content:
"Well, I'd love to, Terra," Samuel starts, "but I'd rather not embarrass [your name] any more. Unlike some people, I actually know when to stop. Besides you don't need my help for that."

         "You're cold, Sam," you reply. "(Whisper) You're cold."

         "Eh, that's fine," Teriah says, "besides, Eric would likely chase you for messing up his hair."

         "Then I better start running," he continues. They both walk away, chasing one another, leaving you two alone again. Suddenly, you heard rushing water.

         "You hear that?" You move around to better hear the splashing, until you see that down the hill you see the biggest fountain you've ever come across.

         "Hear what..?" Teriah too gets lost in the vast size of the structure. It must have been at least 7 or 8 stories high and maybe just as wide. Heck, people were lying down on the edge!

         The other thing was that something, make that some things, we're circling around, interacting with each other and even students. One took notice of you and flew towards you.

         It looked like a fairy spirit, and spoke in a really high voice, "Hello, there. I'm Milly, a resident of the Aura Fountain."

         "Aura Fountain?" Teriah asks.

         "Why, yes! This vast fountain is a reservoir of aura, the essences of spirit and emotion. And I know it's somewhat cliché, but this fountain can also grant wishes..!"

         "Really!?" you both simultaneously exclaim.

         Milly was taken aback from that. "... in exchange... for a gold coin."

         Both of you felt ashamed, but you were the only one disheartened. Teriah springs up, "Wait, I think I have one!" She reaches into her bag and looks for it. Two seconds later, out comes a coin.

         Hence the name, it is a gold coin, maybe the size of a half dollar coin, but definitely at least 5 times the weight. There was a vortex on one side and blank on the other.

         "Yep, exactly like that, and you're lucky too; next to silver, gold coins are rare and have a better chance of not having your wish be complete, in your words, bull."

         You snicker at the fact that a celestial being just said that and that was enough to throw your upsetting mood away. "Well, congrats, Tariah."

         "Thanks, [your name], but what should I do?"

         "The choice is yours; I'm not gonna make it for you."

         What does she do?
1121111112.title: The School's Aura Fountain

info.brief_description: You enroll at a school designed to teach Witches and Warlocks.
info.description:
Welcome students! to the Academy of Thaumatology and Arcane Practices for Witches and Warlocks, or Arcane Academy for short. Every school at a high-school level or above teaches some level of magic, but what makes Arcane Academy different is how it produces some of the most powerful Warlocks and Witches in the world! Of course the school still teaches things such as math, history, chemistry and P.E. which are all required for a decent level of magic as well.

Just a couple of rules before we start.

>please use your best grammar, I have a low tolerance for 1337 (ex. lol, jk, omg, etc.)
but minor spelling/grammatical errors are usually fine.

>as per the usual for my stories, Romance is allowed and actually is encouraged, just remember that this is not an erotica.

>Try not to make chapters too short and please keep it interesting.

>Keep the story going! No adding any chapters that will end the story.

>No adding any non-original characters, such as Naruto or Sailor Moon

This story takes place on earth and history still works out relatively the same way, such as JFK's assassination still happened but this time there really was a magic bullet!
Unlike my previous story, this one allows for the lead to be Male OR Female rather than just having a Male lead. Also, monsters exist and are hunted professionally by mages.
Jobs can be taken between classes. Anything from Janitorial duties to Monster hunting jobs.
Magical power is drawn from both the mage, and the environment. Water based spells are more powerful around watery areas, such as lakes or rivers; While Earth magic is more powerful in the mountainous areas of the world. However, A strong enough mage could still create a powerful fire based spell even while underwater. But that requires near-mastery.

The schools of magic include, but are not limited to, Pyromancy (Heat magic), Aquamancy (Water control/purification magic), Auramancy (Magic specifically drawn from a mage), Photomancy (Light magic), and so on. There's no such thing as Cryomancy. In fact, Pyromancers have control over things such as ice because in science cold does not exist, it is merely the lack of heat. Since Pyromancers can control the temperature around them, they can also do things such as create ice around them. The same rule applies to photomancers, while darkness does not exist but instead is a lack of light and they can control the amount of light in the area and in turn retract light to create darkness.

Yay Science!

Also, because of the required understanding for most magics to work, there are very few spells and incantations that surpass scientific knowledge. Originally, during the middle ages when magic was becoming more and more frequent, mages were the scholars and would record the different effects of different magics. As scientific abilities advanced over time there was a greater understanding of how magic tied in to everything. Pretty soon after that, science was used to understand the world around us with calculated results, rather than magic which, without proper understanding, would be chaotic and dangerous. Scientific studies would be used to understand the world and then the new formed knowledge would be translated into terms that could be understood and used by mages.

Long story short, if we can't understand it with scientific point of view and understanding, it is extremely difficult to replicate it with magic.

*UPDATE* Weapons such as swords, staves, guns, etc. will be commonplace at Arcane Academy, as a good mage always has a backup plan. Monsters may not be effected by certain types of magic, but a bullet or a hard edge will almost always hurt, and some weapons may even be enchanted for added affect.

Please enjoy.

Feel free to ask questions! If you don't understand something about the world or are curious about the different possibilties, send me an E-mail to my on-site inbox. I'll answer anything to the best of my abilities. In fact, if you have a question and I wouldn't know how to answer, or if it's a question to something that I haven't thought up yet, I will make an addition to the world to make it make as much sense as possible. Ask away!
